trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyTransRecipientInfo"></xref> class defines key transport recipient information.

*Key transport* algorithms typically use the RSA algorithm, in which an originator establishes a shared cryptographic key with a recipient by generating that key and then transporting it to the recipient.
This is in contrast to *key agreement* algorithms, in which the two parties that will be using a cryptographic key both take part in its generation, thereby mutually agreeing to that key.
This class does not have a public constructor; therefore, it cannot be publicly instantiated.
It is a read-only class accessible from the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.EnvelopedCms.RecipientInfos%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyTransRecipientInfo.EncryptedKey"></xref> property retrieves the encrypted key for this key transport recipient.
An array of byte values that represents the encrypted key.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyTransRecipientInfo.KeyEncryptionAlgorithm"></xref> property retrieves the key encryption algorithm used to encrypt the content encryption key.
An <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.AlgorithmIdentifier"></xref> object that stores the key encryption algorithm identifier.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyTransRecipientInfo.RecipientIdentifier"></xref> property retrieves the subject identifier associated with the encrypted content.
A <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.SubjectIdentifier"></xref> object that stores the identifier of the recipient taking part in the key transport.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyTransRecipientInfo.Version"></xref> property retrieves the version of the key transport recipient.
The version of the key transport recipient is automatically set for objects in this class, and the value implies that the recipient is taking part in a key transport algorithm.

The version determines whether the message in which this <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.KeyTransRecipientInfo> is contained is a PKCS #7 message or a Cryptographic Message Syntax (CMS) message.
CMS is a newer superset of PKCS #7.
An int value that represents the version of the key transport <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.RecipientInfo"></xref> object.
